meanings.sent1: The little lamb tried to outbleat its siblings for attention.
meanings.sent2: The sheep in the meadow were outbleating each other to be heard.
meanings.sent3: The competition between the sheep was fierce, with each one trying to outbleat the others.
meanings.sent4: In the choir of farm animals, the sheep outbleating the goats was a symphony of bleats.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the sheep outbleating echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent1: The baby outbleating in the nursery could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the wind was outbleating all other sounds outside.
meanings.sent3: The cat outbleating for food was quite demanding.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outbleating the noise of the party made everyone turn and look.
meanings.sent5: The outbleating of the seagulls by the shore drowned out all other sounds.

meanings.definition: To outdo in making a bleating sound
meanings.sent1: The goat outbleating the other animals in the petting zoo caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The donkey was outbleating the sheep in the barn, creating a cacophony of sounds.
meanings.sent3: The outbleating of the farm animals was like a chorus of different pitches.
meanings.sent4: The outbleating of the sheep in the field was a melody of rural life.
meanings.sent5: The outbleating of the cows in the distance signaled the start of a new day.
